abstracts.cdata!:
The Programmatic Fiscal Reform
            Structural Adjustment Loan Project seeks to strengthen the
            foundations for improved growth, poverty reduction, and
            public service delivery by improving a) aggregate fiscal
            performance through incentives for fiscal responsibilities,
            and b) the use of public resources, through better
            allocation and technical efficiency of expenditures,
            including better service delivery to Brazil's citizens
            and improved debt management. The program consists of series
            of actions undertaken during a two-year period 2001-2002 to
            improve fiscal performance. The actions cover implementation
            of the Fiscal Stability Plan and the Law of Fiscal
            Responsibility (LFR); upgrading of the federal financial
            management system, development of the federal multi-annual
            expenditure plan framework, completion of administrative
            reform, and implementation of a program to bring Federal
            debt institutions closer to best practice. The project will
            bring about the following benefits: a) continued aggregate
            fiscal balance; b) improved fiscal planning, transparency,
            and performance incentives; c) an improved federal financial
            management system; d) improved incentives for civil service
            performance; e) a long term expenditure framework; f)
            improved delivery of public services to Brazilian citizens;
            and g) quality of debt management raised to international
            best practice for large open economies.
